costLimit.description: Cost limit in configured currency (default EUR) or CO2 limit in g/kWh
costLimit.name: cost

result.description: Battery mode. 0: unknown, 1: normal, 2: hold, 3: charge

meterStart.description: Meter reading at start of charging session

meterStop.description: Meter reading at end of charging session

active.description: Whether evcc should take the plan into account. `false` means that evcc ignores the plan.

State.description: The actual state structure is not documented yet. Most values should be self-explanatory. Note: While the overall structure is quite stable, details may change between releases.

items.description:
0: Sunday
1: Monday
2: Tuesday
3: Wednesday
4: Thursday
5: Friday
6: Saturday

post.description: Login returns an auth cookie required for all protected endpoints.

schema.example: auth=ey...qY; Path=/; Expires=Fri, 04 Apr 2025 14:35:37 GMT; HttpOnly; SameSite=Strict

post.description: Deletes the authorization cookie

get.description: Whether the current user is logged in.

post.description: Prevent home battery discharge during vehicle fast charging. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/battery)

Charge home battery from grid when price or emissions are below the threshold.
Uses price if a dynamic tariff exists. Uses emissions if a CO₂-tariff is configured. Ignored otherwise.
[Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/battery)

delete.description: Default evcc control behavior is restored

post.description: Directly controls the mode of all controllable batteries. evcc behavior like "price limit" or "prevent discharge while fast charging" is overruled. External mode resets after 60s. The external system has to call this endpoint regularly.
Set battery buffer SoC. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/battery)
Set battery buffer start SoC. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/battery)

get.description: Returns 200 if the evcc loop runs as expected.

post.description: Enables or disables battery boost. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/battery#battery-boost)
Specifies the delay before charging stops in solar mode. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/reference/configuration/loadpoints)
Specifies the grid draw power to stop charging in solar mode. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/reference/configuration/loadpoints#threshold-1)
Specifies the delay before charging starts in solar mode. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/reference/configuration/loadpoints#delay)
Specifies the available surplus power to start charging in solar mode. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/reference/configuration/loadpoints#threshold)

Updates the energy limit of the loadpoint. Only available for guest vehicles and vehicles with unknown SoC. Limit is removed on vehicle disconnect. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/limit)
Updates the SoC limit of the loadpoint. Requires a connected vehicle with known SoC. Limit is maintained across charging sessions. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/limit)
Updates the maximum current of the loadpoint.
Updates the minimum current of the loadpoint.
Changes the charging behavior of the loadpoint. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/solar-charging)

Updates the allowed phases of the loadpoint. Selects the desired phase mode for chargers with automatic phase switching. For manual phase switching chargers (via cable or Lasttrennschalter) this value tells evcc the actual phases. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/reference/configuration/loadpoints#phases)

400.description: Invalid phases-value. You have most likely entered the value 0 for a wallbox that cannot switch phases automatically. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/reference/configuration/loadpoints#phases)

get.description: Returns the current charging plan for this loadpoint. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/plans)

delete.description: Deletes the charging plan. Only available when a vehicle with unknown SoC is connected. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/plans)

post.description: Creates a charging plan with fixed time and energy target. Only available when a vehicle with unknown SoC is connected. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/plans)

get.description: Simulates a repeating charging plan and returns the result. Does not alter the actual charging plan. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/plans)
Simulates a charging plan and returns the result. Does not alter the actual charging plan. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/plans)

socAvailable.summary: If SoC is available => specify SoC in %

socNotAvailable.summary: If SoC is not available => specify energy in kWh

post.description: Sets the priority of the loadpoint. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/reference/configuration/loadpoints#priority)

delete.description: Removes the price or emission limit for fast-charging with grid energy. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/dynamic-prices)

post.description: Sets the price or emission limit for fast-charging with grid energy. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/dynamic-prices)

delete.description: Removes the association of a vehicle to the loadpoint. Connected vehicle is treated as guest vehicle. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/vehicle)

post.description: Changes the association of a vehicle to the loadpoint. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/vehicle)
Set battery priority SoC. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/battery)
Sets target operating point of the control loop. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/reference/configuration/site#residualpower)

get.description: Returns a list of charging sessions. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/sessions)

post.description: Enable or disable telemetry. Note: Telemetry requires [sponsorship](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/sponsorship). [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/reference/configuration/telemetry)

delete.description: Conveniance method to remove limit for all loadpoints at once. Value is applied to each individual loadpoint.
delete.summary: Remove smart charging cost limit for all loadpoints.

post.description: Conveniance method to set smart charging cost limit for all loadpoints at once. Value is applied to each individual loadpoint.
post.summary: Set smart charging cost limit for all loadpoints

get.description: Returns the complete state of the system. This structure is used by the UI. It can be filtered by [JQ](https://jqlang.github.io/jq/) to only return a subset of the data. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/reference/configuration/state)

parameters.description: Number of log lines to return
parameters.name: count

get.description: Returns a list of all log areas (e.g. `lp-1`, `site`, `db`).

post.description: Shuts down the evcc instance.  There is no reboot command. We expect the underlying system (docker, systemd, etc.) to restart the evcc instance once it's terminated.

get.description: Returns the prices or emission values for the upcoming hours [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/devices/tariffs)

post.description: Charging will stop when this SoC is reached. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/limits)
Vehicle will be fast-charged until this SoC is reached. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/limits)
Updates the repeating charging plan. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/plans)
Creates a charging plan with fixed time and SoC target. [Read more.](https://docs.evcc.io/en/docs/features/plans)
